Summary: I have seen so many UFO's over the past summer but the one that really caught my attention is the fire and how low it was it was right above the pine tree line
divs: Sighting DetailsOk I had made my report back in May and I got to frankly with you I thought what I seen was a asteroid but then I realized that it was moving so slow and hovering over pine tree lines I was out on my back patio cutting wood to build a fire to take the chill out of my house because it would still get cool out at nights being that summer was coming up 3 weeks before that we traded our oil in for a wood and coal burner so I first I thought to my self someone was burning wood up here on the hill that was my first reaction to it as it got over the tree's it was a as to what some would say your crazy and out of your mind a big red fire ball and it was that close to me that it will stick in my mind till the day I die and I know dozens of people said they seen the same deal But the strange thing that boggles my mind is my neighbors were out that night and I was yelling to them to look up but they didn't see it as it was going over the house they move so slow that I had enough time to get in my house to yell for my mom we watched what we still to this day can't be explained right after that like a week later I was driving to pick my mom up from work I looking towards the moon and once again seen it heading for the moon and it would dissipate then the summer came on and we would see them fly over ever night like these star light objects it's like they would show up out of no where other people started talking about on what they were seeing One night me and a friend was hanging out in my yard about 12 am 1 am one came down out of no were coming right for us I was scared to death it stopped over my house it was low and it stayed in one spot for like a minute and moved off like it was nothing I seen what they can do and it's sick the way they can move OK I'm putting a picture close to what I saw! any comment's or question contact me [pid] I'll share my story with anyone
